events.description_detail: Celebrate the Holiday Spirit of Fiesta NavideÃ±a at the Mexican Heritage Plaza!Every December, the Mexican Heritage Plaza (La Plaza) shines with twinkling dÃ©cor, an 18-foot Christmas tree, and community cheer. This year, the 15th annual Fiesta NavideÃ±a lights up the night on Saturday, December 13. The celebration features a free concert by Carlos y Charlos, whose passionate norteÃ±o and conjunto sounds will resonate through the Mayfair neighborhood for La Plazaâ€™s final event of the year.As the evening falls, families gather to enjoy festive activities for all ages, including an enchanting folklÃ³rico performance by longtime partners Los LupeÃ±os de San JosÃ©. Guests can participate in an interactive posada, celebrating a cherished Mexican tradition of hospitality while welcoming the holiday season, presented by Teatro Vision. The night will also feature an art workshop for all ages, local vendors offering handmade crafts and gifts, and the delicious aroma of steaming tamales.â€œFor many people from the local community, the Mexican Heritage Plaza serves as a second home, a place where they can celebrate traditions from Mexico and across Latin America. For years, Fiesta NavideÃ±a has brought generations together to honor culture, faith, and family. Attendees may have traveled here and left their motherland, but they carry traditions with them, and itâ€™s our duty to be the place where they can come together and celebrate.â€Read moreCategory: Holiday, Christmas

events.title: FHS PTSA presents College Planning Roadmap for Juniors
events.location: Fremont High School, 575 West Fremont Avenue, Sunnyvale, CA 94087
events.description_preview: Get ready, juniors! Join us for a College Planning Roadmap event with speaker Syrous Parsay.This eve...
events.description_detail: Get ready, juniors! Join us for a College Planning Roadmap event with speaker Syrous Parsay.This event will take place in the Fair Oaks Room on the FHS campus.The College application process can be overwhelming and intimidating for both parents and students. There are a myriad of decisions, conflicting information, and as the result the stress level tends to be high. Come join us for this informative lecture on "College Planning Road Map - Junior Class". This workshop will provide the attendees with an understanding of the application process for the Junior Class, and how to reduce the stress of getting through it all.The session will focus on the following topics:Admission puzzlePandemic changesCollege profiling and selectionMajor selectionWriting effective essaysSubmission strategiesScholarships & Financial aidSummer planning (internships, workshops, etc.)Managing the stress of the processList of useful resourcesPlease come prepared to take notes. Photos or recording of the lecture is prohibited, and there will be no handouts.Read moreCategory: Family & Education, Education

For the D ream-Builders, Money-Makers, and Freedom-Chasers, are you ready to redefine your WHY, supercharge your GOALS, and find a purpose that truly pays off?G et set to join a vibrant commmunity of real estate enthusiasts, a band of modern -day moguls turning houses into cash flow. Yes, you read that right - all legal, and ethical!W e're also about networking because we believe in the power of collaberation. events.title: Lectures on Tap- The Search for Quantum Gravity in Antarctica
events.location: Nob Hill, Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA 94109
events.description_preview: Professors, experts, and storytellers giving thought-provoking lectures in SF bars.ðŸ“ Location: Exac...
events.description_detail: Professors, experts, and storytellers giving thought-provoking lectures in SF bars.ðŸ“ Location: Exact address found in the confirmation emailðŸ“š Lecture: â€œThe Search for Quantum Gravity in Antarcticaâ€ðŸŽ¤ Speaker: Dr. Grant Kendrick ParkerJoin us for a captivating evening as Dr. Grant Kendrick Parker takes us on a journey to the icy depths of Antarctica, home to the IceCube Neutrino Observatory, a groundbreaking particle detector buried more than a mile below the surface. This unique facility is tasked with observing neutrinosâ€”special particles that travel from our atmosphere and even from distant galaxies.In this lecture, Dr. Parker will share how he uses the data collected from IceCube to explore the fundamental nature of spacetime and test theories of quantum gravity involving microscopic black holes.Dr. Grant Kendrick Parker is a particle physicist at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, where he investigates some of the deepest mysteries in physics. His dissertation research has been published in prestigious journals such as Nature Physics and Physical Review Letters. Currently, he is focused on understanding the matter-antimatter asymmetry in the universe and developing new machine learning tools for particle detectors.Donâ€™t miss this enlightening opportunity to learn about the intersection of physics and exploration with Dr. Grant Kendrick Parker!Get a drink, connect, and learn at Lectures on Tap! ðŸ™ŒAgenda6:30 PM â€“ Doors open: find a seat (open seating!), order food & drinks, and expect a bar lineâ€”arriving early is key.6:55 PM â€“ Host introduction7:00 PM â€“ Lecture begins7:45 PM â€“ Audience Q&A8:00 PM â€“ Have 1:1 time with the speaker, mingle with fellow guests, and order another round8:30 PM â€“ Wrap up.Read moreCategory: Community, Other

events.title: The Original San Jose Nutcracker
events.location: San Jose Center for the Performing Arts, 255 South Almaden Boulevard, San Jose, CA 95113
events.description_preview: Join our 60th Anniversary production of the holiday classic for the Land of Sweets Spectacular â€œCand...
events.description_detail: Join our 60th Anniversary production of the holiday classic for the Land of Sweets Spectacular â€œCandyland Matineeâ€!Step into a world where dreams come to life and holiday magic fills the air! Celebrate the 60th Jubilee Anniversary of The Original San Jose Nutcracker, an enchanting ballet that has been a cherished San Jose holiday tradition for generations.Join us December 13-14 & 20-21, 2025 at the San Jose Center for the Performing Arts for a timeless journey featuring brave toy soldiers, shimmering snowflakes, and the elegance of waltzing flowers. Witness the epic battle between courageous soldiers and mischievous mice, all set beneath a breathtaking 60-foot Christmas tree.This yearâ€™s landmark production is proudly accompanied by The Cambrian Symphony, bringing Tchaikovskyâ€™s unforgettable score to life with the power and beauty of a live orchestra.Join our VIP Experience â€” Donâ€™t just see The Nutcracker, live it! Enjoy a pre-performance backstage tour to see the magic behind the scenes, then join the cast in the exclusive Candy Kingdom Party filled with sweet treats, festive crafts, and photo opportunities with beloved characters.Help us celebrate 60 years by enjoying one of our special themed performances to elevate your holiday experience:December 13th 2:00pm: A Very Nutcracker Holiday â€œUgly Sweater & Sparkles Matineeâ€! Come dressed in your most festive holiday attire â€” the tackier, the better! Ugly sweaters, sparkly scarves, and holiday hats encouraged. Enjoy a family-focused show full of seasonal cheer and Nutcracker magic.December 13th 7:30pm: Clara's Homecoming - Alumni Night! Celebrate 60 magical years with past performers, friends, and family returning to the stage and the audience.December 14th 2:00pm: Land of Sweets Spectacular â€œCandyland Matineeâ€! A treat-themed matinee where everyone can enjoy a little extra sweetness â€” themed concessions, pink and pastel decor, and candy cane treats.December 20th 2:00pm: Clara & Sugar Plum Dress-Up Day â€œTutus & Tiaras Matineeâ€! Little ones are invited to dress up as their favorite Nutcracker characters! From Sugar Plums to Mouse Kings, this show is all about imagination and sparkle. Great for first-time balletgoers and families.December 20th 7:30pm: Twilight in the Candy Kingdom: Family Pride Night! An inclusive, joyful celebration for all families â€” with glittering treats, bold costumes, and a pre-show character meet-and-greet with our radiant Mother Cupcake.December 21st 2:00pm: Storybook Sunday: Nutcracker Edition! Focuses on the tale behind the ballet â€” lobby storytelling, digital â€œread-alongâ€ Nutcracker story, and a magical moment for young readers.Let The Original San Jose Nutcracker ignite your imagination and create treasured memories during this dazzling Jubilee celebration!Read moreCategory: Arts, Ballet

events.title: SF Ghost Hunting Tour in Chinatown with a Paranormal Investigator
events.location: The Haunt SF Ghost Tours, 598 Clay Street, San Francisco, CA 94111
events.description_preview: Join San Franciscoâ€™s real ghost hunting excursion through Gold Rush-era neighborhoods after dark, se...
events.description_detail: Join San Franciscoâ€™s real ghost hunting excursion through Gold Rush-era neighborhoods after dark, seeking out evidence of the paranormal.Welcome to The Haunt, a ghost hunting tour led by a professional paranormal investigator. Meet your guide near Chinatown in the Jackson Square Historic District -- a little-known Gold Rush-era neighborhood with eerie, well-preserved Victorian architecture.Your tour guide will outfit everyone with an EMF meter that you'll use throughout the paranormal investigation, and explain the types of hauntings and ghosts that we encounter in San Francisco.From there we'll enter the old neighborhood, hearing about the forgotten graves and ships buried beneath us.Down quiet alleyways, we'll learn of the destruction of the Great Earthquake of 1906, and the residual hauntings that still plague the neighborhood.At any point, we might detect EMF activity, and we'll investigate further using tools such as dowsing rods and a Spirit Box.In Chinatown, we'll learn of the tragedies that mark the neighborhood's past, including the true crimes whose energies still linger, from a mysterious death in a historic theatre, to the city's biggest massacre at the Golden Dragon.We'll end the investigation with a ceremony to honor whatever spirits joined us, with a ritual to ensure that nothing follows you home.Read moreCategory: Holiday, Halloween
